column1: H2 blockers are medicines that work by reducing the amount of stomach acid secreted by glands in the lining of your stomach.
H2 blockers are used to: - Relieve symptoms of acid reflux, or gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).
This is a condition where food or liquid moves up from the stomach into the esophagus (the tube from the mouth to the stomach).

- Famotidine (Pepcid AC, Pepcid Oral) - Cimetidine (Tagamet, Tagamet HB) - Ranitidine (Zantac, Zantac 75, Zantac Efferdose, Zantac injection, and Zantac Syrup) - Nizatidine Capsules (Axid AR, Axid Capsules, Nizatidine Capsules)
People often take the drugs at bedtime, as well.
